title: Verify Successful Credit Card Payment
objective: To verify that a customer can successfully complete a purchase using a valid credit card
preconditions: User is logged into the platform
User has items in cart (total > $10)
Payment gateway is operational
Test credit card credentials available

test_steps.action: Navigate to shopping cart
test_steps.expected_result: Cart page displays with selected items

test_steps.action: Click 'Proceed to Checkout' button
test_steps.expected_result: Checkout page loads with shipping information form

test_steps.action: Enter shipping address: Name: 'John Doe', Address: '123 Main St', City: 'San Francisco', State: 'CA', ZIP: '94102'
test_steps.expected_result: Shipping address is accepted and saved

test_steps.action: Click 'Continue to Payment' button
test_steps.expected_result: Payment page loads with payment method options

test_steps.action: Select 'Credit Card' as payment method
test_steps.expected_result: Credit card form appears with fields for card number, expiry, CVV

test_steps.action: Enter credit card details: Card Number: '4111111111111111', Expiry: '12/25', CVV: '123', Name: 'John Doe'
test_steps.expected_result: Card details are accepted, no validation errors displayed

test_steps.action: Review order summary and click 'Place Order' button
test_steps.expected_result: Order is submitted, loading indicator appears

test_steps.action: Wait for payment processing
test_steps.expected_result: Payment processes successfully, order confirmation page displays

test_steps.action: Verify order confirmation details: Order number, items, total amount, shipping address, payment method
test_steps.expected_result: All order details are correct and match the placed order

test_steps.action: Check email inbox for order confirmation email
test_steps.expected_result: Order confirmation email received within 2 minutes with correct order details

expected_results: Order status set to 'Confirmed' in database
notes: This is a critical path test case. Should be executed before every release.

title: Verify Payment Failure Handling with Declined Card
objective: To verify that the system properly handles a declined credit card and displays appropriate error messages
preconditions: User is logged into the platform
User has items in cart
Test declined card credentials available

test_steps.action: Navigate to checkout and proceed to payment page
test_steps.expected_result: Payment page loads successfully

test_steps.action: Select 'Credit Card' as payment method
test_steps.expected_result: Credit card form displays

test_steps.action: Enter declined test card details: Card Number: '4000000000000002', Expiry: '12/25', CVV: '123'
test_steps.expected_result: Card details accepted (format validation passes)

test_steps.action: Click 'Place Order' button
test_steps.expected_result: Order submission attempted, payment processing begins

test_steps.action: Observe payment processing
test_steps.expected_result: Payment gateway returns declined status

test_steps.action: Verify error message displayed to user
test_steps.expected_result: Clear error message: 'Your card was declined. Please try a different payment method or contact your bank.'

test_steps.action: Verify user remains on payment page
test_steps.expected_result: User stays on payment page, can retry with different card

test_steps.action: Verify order status in system
test_steps.expected_result: Order status is 'Pending' or 'Payment Failed', not 'Confirmed'

test_steps.action: Verify inventory is not decremented
test_steps.expected_result: Product stock levels remain unchanged

test_steps.action: Verify no confirmation email sent
test_steps.expected_result: No order confirmation email in inbox

notes: Test with multiple declined card scenarios: insufficient funds, expired card, invalid CVV

title: Verify Multi-Factor Authentication Setup
objective: To verify that users can successfully enable MFA using an authenticator app
preconditions: User is logged into the platform
User does not have MFA enabled
Authenticator app installed on mobile device

test_steps.action: Navigate to Account Settings > Security
test_steps.expected_result: Security settings page loads

test_steps.action: Locate 'Two-Factor Authentication' section
test_steps.expected_result: MFA section displays with 'Enable' button

test_steps.action: Click 'Enable Two-Factor Authentication' button
test_steps.expected_result: MFA setup wizard opens

test_steps.action: Select 'Authenticator App' as MFA method
test_steps.expected_result: QR code is displayed along with manual entry key

test_steps.action: Open authenticator app and scan QR code
test_steps.expected_result: Account is added to authenticator app, 6-digit code starts generating

test_steps.action: Enter the 6-digit code from authenticator app into verification field
test_steps.expected_result: Code is accepted, verification successful message displayed

test_steps.action: Review and save backup codes displayed
test_steps.expected_result: 10 unique backup codes are displayed with download/print options

test_steps.action: Click 'Download Backup Codes' and then 'Finish Setup'
test_steps.expected_result: Backup codes downloaded, MFA setup complete confirmation displayed

test_steps.action: Verify MFA status on Security settings page
test_steps.expected_result: MFA shows as 'Enabled' with option to disable

test_steps.action: Log out and attempt to log back in
test_steps.expected_result: After entering password, prompted for 6-digit MFA code

test_steps.action: Enter current code from authenticator app
test_steps.expected_result: Login successful, user is authenticated

notes: Test with multiple authenticator apps. Also test manual key entry if QR scan not available.

title: Verify Order History Display
objective: To verify that users can view their complete order history with accurate information
preconditions: User is logged into the platform
User has at least 5 orders in different statuses
Order data is properly seeded in test database

test_steps.action: Navigate to Account Dashboard
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard page loads successfully

test_steps.action: Click on 'Order History' or 'My Orders' link
test_steps.expected_result: Order history page loads displaying list of orders

test_steps.action: Verify orders are sorted by date (most recent first)
test_steps.expected_result: Orders appear in descending chronological order

test_steps.action: Verify each order displays: Order number, Date, Total amount, Status
test_steps.expected_result: All orders show required information in list view

test_steps.action: Verify status badges display correctly (e.g., 'Delivered' in green, 'Cancelled' in red)
test_steps.expected_result: Status indicators are color-coded and easily distinguishable

test_steps.action: Click on an order to view details
test_steps.expected_result: Order details page opens

test_steps.action: Verify order details include: Items with images, Quantities, Prices, Shipping address, Payment method, Order timeline
test_steps.expected_result: All order information is displayed accurately

test_steps.action: For a shipped order, verify tracking information is displayed
test_steps.expected_result: Tracking number and carrier displayed with 'Track Shipment' link

test_steps.action: Click 'Download Invoice' button
test_steps.expected_result: PDF invoice downloads with correct order information

test_steps.action: Return to order list and test pagination (if more than 10 orders)
test_steps.expected_result: Pagination works correctly, displays correct orders per page

notes: Test with various order statuses. Ensure real-time status updates are reflected.

title: Verify Full Refund Processing
objective: To verify that customer service representatives can successfully process full refunds
preconditions: CS rep is logged into admin portal
Order exists in 'Delivered' or 'Completed' status
Order is within refund window (30 days)
Payment was processed successfully

test_steps.action: Login to admin portal as Customer Service Rep
test_steps.expected_result: Admin dashboard loads successfully

test_steps.action: Navigate to Orders > Search Orders
test_steps.expected_result: Order search page displays

test_steps.action: Search for order using order number
test_steps.expected_result: Order is found and displays in search results

test_steps.action: Click on order to view details
test_steps.expected_result: Order details page opens showing full order information

test_steps.action: Verify order is eligible for refund (status, date, payment method)
test_steps.expected_result: Order meets refund criteria, 'Process Refund' button is enabled

test_steps.action: Click 'Process Refund' button
test_steps.expected_result: Refund dialog box opens

test_steps.action: Select 'Full Refund' option and enter reason: 'Customer request - product not as expected'
test_steps.expected_result: Refund amount auto-populated with order total, reason field accepts text

test_steps.action: Review refund summary: Amount, Method (original payment method), Processing time
test_steps.expected_result: Refund summary displays correctly with all details

test_steps.action: Click 'Confirm Refund' button
test_steps.expected_result: Confirmation dialog appears

test_steps.action: Confirm refund initiation
test_steps.expected_result: Refund is processed, success message displayed

test_steps.action: Verify order status updated to 'Refunded'
test_steps.expected_result: Order status shows 'Refunded' with timestamp

test_steps.action: Verify refund transaction is logged in order timeline
test_steps.expected_result: Timeline shows refund entry with date, time, amount, and CS rep name

test_steps.action: Check customer's email for refund notification
test_steps.expected_result: Customer receives email confirming refund with amount and ETA

test_steps.action: Verify inventory is restocked (if applicable)
test_steps.expected_result: Product quantities are incremented

notes: Also test partial refunds, refunds for different payment methods (PayPal, Credit Card). Verify refund policy enforcement.

title: Verify Real-time Inventory Update on Order Placement
objective: To verify that inventory levels decrease correctly when an order is placed
preconditions: Product has sufficient stock (qty >= 5)
Initial inventory level recorded
No other orders being processed for same product

test_steps.action: Check initial inventory level for product via admin portal
test_steps.expected_result: Current stock level displayed (e.g., 50 units)

test_steps.action: As customer, add 3 units of product to cart
test_steps.expected_result: Product added to cart, cart shows 3 units

test_steps.action: Verify inventory is reserved (soft lock) in admin portal
test_steps.expected_result: Available inventory shows 47 units (50 - 3 reserved)

test_steps.action: Proceed to checkout but do not complete order, wait 20 minutes
test_steps.expected_result: After timeout (15 min), reservation is released, inventory back to 50

test_steps.action: Add 3 units to cart again and complete checkout immediately
test_steps.expected_result: Order placed successfully

test_steps.action: Verify inventory is hard-locked (decremented) immediately after payment confirmation
test_steps.expected_result: Inventory shows 47 units (50 - 3 = 47)

test_steps.action: Verify inventory decrement is logged with timestamp and order number
test_steps.expected_result: Inventory audit log shows: -3 units, timestamp, order number, reason: 'Order placement'

test_steps.action: Attempt to add 48 units to cart (more than available)
test_steps.expected_result: Error message: 'Only 47 units available'

test_steps.action: Verify low stock alert triggers (if inventory < threshold)
test_steps.expected_result: If stock falls below threshold (e.g., 50), alert notification sent to inventory manager

notes: Test concurrent orders for same product to verify race condition handling. Critical for preventing overselling.

title: Verify Product Search with Filters
objective: To verify that product search returns relevant results and filters work correctly
test_data_required: Product catalog with varied categories and prices
preconditions: Product catalog is populated with test data
Search index is up-to-date
At least 50 products across multiple categories

test_steps.action: Navigate to homepage
test_steps.expected_result: Homepage loads with search bar visible

test_steps.action: Enter search term 'headphones' in search bar
test_steps.expected_result: Auto-complete suggestions appear showing products and categories

test_steps.action: Press Enter or click Search button
test_steps.expected_result: Search results page loads showing products matching 'headphones'

test_steps.action: Verify search results are relevant (contain 'headphones' in title or description)
test_steps.expected_result: All displayed products are headphones or related audio products

test_steps.action: Verify result count is displayed (e.g., '45 results found')
test_steps.expected_result: Result count shown at top of page

test_steps.action: Apply price filter: Min: $50, Max: $200
test_steps.expected_result: Results update to show only products within price range, result count updates

test_steps.action: Apply category filter: Select 'Wireless'
test_steps.expected_result: Results further filtered to show only wireless headphones in price range

test_steps.action: Apply rating filter: 4 stars and above
test_steps.expected_result: Only products with rating >= 4.0 are displayed

test_steps.action: Change sort order to 'Price: Low to High'
test_steps.expected_result: Products re-sorted with lowest priced items first

test_steps.action: Verify all applied filters are displayed as chips/tags with remove option
test_steps.expected_result: Active filters shown as removable chips above results

test_steps.action: Click 'Clear All Filters' button
test_steps.expected_result: All filters removed, results return to initial search results for 'headphones'

test_steps.action: Test search with typo: 'hedphones' (missing 'a')
test_steps.expected_result: System suggests 'Did you mean: headphones?' and shows headphone results

test_steps.action: Verify search performance: Note response time
test_steps.expected_result: Search results load in <500ms

test_execution_history.notes: Search functionality working well, average response time: 280ms

notes: Also test: empty search results, special characters, very long search terms, multiple filter combinations

title: Verify Order Confirmation Email Notification
objective: To verify that customers receive order confirmation emails with correct information
preconditions: Email service is operational
Test user has valid email address
User has not opted out of transactional emails

test_steps.action: Complete a test order as customer
test_steps.expected_result: Order placed successfully, order confirmation page displayed

test_steps.action: Note order number and timestamp
test_steps.expected_result: Order number and timestamp recorded

test_steps.action: Check email inbox within 2 minutes
test_steps.expected_result: Order confirmation email received

test_steps.action: Verify email sender: 'noreply@platform.com' or 'orders@platform.com'
test_steps.expected_result: Email from recognized company sender

test_steps.action: Verify email subject line: 'Order Confirmation - #[Order Number]'
test_steps.expected_result: Subject contains order number

test_steps.action: Verify email body contains: Order number, Order date, Items with quantities and prices, Shipping address, Payment method (last 4 digits only), Order total, Estimated delivery date
test_steps.expected_result: All order details present and accurate

test_steps.action: Verify email contains 'Track Your Order' link
test_steps.expected_result: Link present and properly formatted

test_steps.action: Click 'Track Your Order' link
test_steps.expected_result: Link opens to order details page with correct order loaded

test_steps.action: Verify email footer contains: Company contact information, Unsubscribe link (for marketing), Privacy policy link, Social media links
test_steps.expected_result: Footer complete with all required elements

test_steps.action: Verify email formatting is responsive (view on mobile)
test_steps.expected_result: Email displays correctly on mobile devices

test_steps.action: Verify no sensitive information exposed (full card number, CVV, password)
test_steps.expected_result: Only last 4 digits of payment method shown

test_execution_history.notes: Email received in 45 seconds, all information correct

notes: Test across different email clients: Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail. Verify spam filtering.

title: Verify User Profile Update
objective: To verify that users can successfully update their profile information
preconditions: User is logged into the platform
User has existing profile information

test_steps.action: Navigate to Account Settings > Profile
test_steps.expected_result: Profile page loads with current information displayed

test_steps.action: Click 'Edit Profile' button
test_steps.expected_result: Profile fields become editable

test_steps.action: Update First Name: Change from 'John' to 'Jonathan'
test_steps.expected_result: Field accepts new value

test_steps.action: Update Phone Number: Change to '+1-555-9999'
test_steps.expected_result: Phone number field accepts format, validates correctly

test_steps.action: Attempt to enter invalid phone format: '123'
test_steps.expected_result: Validation error: 'Please enter a valid phone number'

test_steps.action: Correct phone number to valid format
test_steps.expected_result: Validation error clears

test_steps.action: Upload new profile picture (2MB JPG file)
test_steps.expected_result: Image uploads successfully, preview shown

test_steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button
test_steps.expected_result: Saving indicator appears, then success message displayed

test_steps.action: Verify changes are reflected in profile view
test_steps.expected_result: Updated name, phone, and profile picture displayed

test_steps.action: Verify changes persisted: Logout and login again
test_steps.expected_result: After re-login, profile still shows updated information

test_steps.action: Verify audit log records the changes
test_steps.expected_result: Profile changes logged with timestamp and fields modified

test_execution_history.notes: Profile update smooth, validation working well

notes: Test with various image formats and sizes. Test concurrent updates from multiple sessions.

title: Verify Sales Dashboard Data Accuracy
objective: To verify that the sales dashboard displays accurate metrics and data
preconditions: Manager role account logged in
Test data seeded in database with known values
Dashboard has access to complete data

test_steps.action: Navigate to Reports > Sales Dashboard
test_steps.expected_result: Sales dashboard loads successfully

test_steps.action: Select date range: 'Last 7 Days'
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard updates to show data for past 7 days

test_steps.action: Manually calculate expected total revenue from database for date range
test_steps.expected_result: Known expected value calculated (e.g., $12,450.00)

test_steps.action: Compare dashboard 'Total Revenue' metric with calculated value
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard shows $12,450.00 (matches calculation)

test_steps.action: Verify 'Total Orders' count matches database
test_steps.expected_result: Count matches (e.g., 187 orders)

test_steps.action: Calculate Average Order Value: Revenue / Orders = $12,450 / 187
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard AOV = $66.58 (matches calculation)

test_steps.action: Verify 'Top Selling Product' matches database query
test_steps.expected_result: Top product matches (e.g., 'Wireless Headphones' - 45 units)

test_steps.action: Check revenue trend chart for date range
test_steps.expected_result: Chart shows daily revenue, data points match daily totals from database

test_steps.action: Apply filter: Category = 'Electronics'
test_steps.expected_result: All metrics update to show Electronics-only data

test_steps.action: Verify filtered revenue matches database query for Electronics
test_steps.expected_result: Filtered revenue matches calculated value

test_steps.action: Export data as CSV
test_steps.expected_result: CSV file downloads with dashboard data

test_steps.action: Open CSV and spot-check 10 random records against database
test_steps.expected_result: All checked records match database exactly

test_steps.action: Change date range to 'Custom: Nov 1-15, 2024'
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard recalculates for custom range

test_steps.action: Verify 'New Customers' count is accurate
test_steps.expected_result: Count matches database query for first-time customers in range

test_execution_history.notes: All metrics verified accurate. Dashboard performance good.

notes: Critical test case. Dashboard accuracy directly impacts business decisions. Test with large datasets.
